Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but nothing Great...!”
Reviews.Author: saurav_joshi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on a family vacation in March 2012 for 3 nights and overall happy with the experience. I booked upfront at the desk and the booking manager matched the online price which was good. Was initially upset with the allotted room as it looked completely different from what was shown on the web page so after spending one night in a smaller room I complained to Marketing staff and they were really really very good. They were very very friendly and happily agreed to change my room and moved me into a bigger and comfortable room. Cheers to that!! I would recommend to check the room before you actually check-in because some rooms really are small. The morning breakfast was included in the room price and it was very good. New menu everyday and especially the Indian menus were great too. Bath fittings and other small things could have been better but I think its okay for that price. Overall a good Hotel... Great Location.... Great Service...!!

Reviews.Title: “JUST FAIR...”
Reviews.Author: sax426
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights at the end of January 2012. Noted some minor improvements over last stay 2 years back to witness the opening of the Burj Khalifa (acclaimed "tallest building inthe world")The rooms were tidy. The internet though now "free" had no reception in the 2nd and 3rd floors so had to take the laptop all the way down to the mezzanine floor where reception was better. The location of the hotel in the Bur Dubai area was quite accessible to major shopping areas and sundry businesses. Sadly the buffet breakfast quality had dropped from the level in 2010. Restaurant meals were rather too "indian". Hey, we aren't all mumbai spicey eaters!

Reviews.Title: “relaxed family place”
Reviews.Author: rajmylestone
Reviews.Content: right in between all the action yet very relaxed and comfortable, clean rooms, clean approach, clean linen, good food, excellent location near meena bazar shopping area, lot's of choices for all kinds of meals in all budget ranges, just the right place for indians who prefer indian vegetarian food, great kabab shops, lot's to shop with established gold merchants like joyallukas just around the corner, the hotel is absolute value for money, rooms could be a little larger in size but all the other advantages make up for that, the surprise is the simple indoor swimming pool, expect comfort not 5star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for one or more nights..”
Reviews.Author: Ralph W
Reviews.Content: Stayed over each way on our way to Europe. Staff friendly room clean also included breakfast. We have no compaints as to service or rooms. one only needs to stay in France to expiriance SMALL rooms and not forgetting stairsways, lots of hotels in mainline Europe are yet to get a lift installed.. When priced compered this hotel is OKay. Also, people of whatever add colour to a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: mikaelbos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in December 2011 with a group of 17 students doing a business project. I stayed in a 3-person room #334. The hotel has a free wi-fi but it doesn't always work and it works only in a few first-floor rooms and some places of lobby. There is a business center with a few computers and internet. Admiral Plaza Hotel (nowdays Coral Admiral Plaza Hotel, by the way) is not very well known among the taxi drivers even though it's been there over a decade. Sometimes we told the driver to take us to "Royal Ascot Hotel" which is a nearby 5-star well known hotel. Metro station is about 10-15 min walk away through a straight route. The station is green line and next one has a connection to red line. Our shower had seperate hot and cold water taps which I've always hated because they're not as easy to adjust as just one tap with both. Our room (334) had a crazy A/C that either was too hard to operate or broken. It was always either hot and moist or just plain cold. Some other rooms had newer digital A/C:s which worked just fine. Our room had a large construction yard in the next block. They were building 24/7 and the noice was there day and night and it came inside the room. The beds were nice and I saw no bugs at all during our 10-day stay. Room service didn't work very well. We once ordered a breakfast for the next morning. After about five calls from us to room service and vice versa, the custom breakfast for our friend with a birthday, was not ready on time and we had to cancel it next morning. I asked for the cheapest way to make local phone calls. The receptionist told me to use the phone found in my room. Two minutes of local calls made a bill of 19 EUR or 25 USD. After complaining I got it for free and was told that the phone in reception is actually FREE to use. This, the confusion with room service and other small things made me not to trust the staff very much, even though they were friendly. One strange thing noted here often is that the reception actually takes away your passports. I did not like that, but gave it away and got it back without problems. For some it was a problem as we needed some ID later on and all did not have extra-ID's with them. Most other quests were indian and the hotel was located on a non-luxorious area but it did not matter at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not as shown on webpage!”
Reviews.Author: VisaElectron
Reviews.Content: Some have said the location is great - not so sure about that. Dubai metro is nearby, but hotel is almost impossible to find. Lots of COCKROACHES in our room. Bad air. No alcohol served. Passports are held in Reception. Never again. Not for western people. Located in the middle of indiantown! Traffic sounds all night. Complimentary water only on check-in day.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Westerners”
Reviews.Author: wendy w
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is not for western people it was full of Indians who were well looked after, our passports were held by reception which we were not happy about and could not get back until we checked out, no 24 room service as advertised it a dry hotel which is we were not told about, western diet was not catered for good location but poor in every other respect

Reviews.Title: “Duabi has many choices for travelers; don't EVER stay here”
Reviews.Author: jmarquiss
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed in Dubai many times; we live in Abu Dhabi and often travel to Dubai for a change of scenery and a stroll along the creek. This time, we decided to book at the last minute, during the four-day weekend of Eid Al Adha. The cheapest rate available on Hotels.com was 435 Euros (2,200 dirhams) for two nights at the Admiral Plaza Hotel - a three-star property near the Creek in Bur Dubai. None of the other places where we often stay were available and the hotel description sounded adequate, although you usually pay less than this for a five-star hotel in Dubai these days.. We booked the hotel and drove to Dubai the next day. Everything went wrong from the moment we arrived. The unloading area at the hotel can only accommodate three cars, and a line-up was backed way out into a busy street in this VERY busy neighborhood. After about 25 minutes, we were able to pull up to the front and unload our bags. We pulled as far ahead as we could and went inside to register. There were three people working at the reception desk; the one who assisted us told us that they had no reservation for us. We found our Hotels.com voucher, showed it to them, and were told to wait in the reception area. Twenty minutes later, we were told we had to move our car because it was blocking a tour bus. The hotel has NO parking area whatsoever, so my partner was directed to a paid lot some 5 to 10 minutes away from the hotel (walking distance) to park our car. (The lot is about 50 dirhams a day.) We waited a further 25 minutes after he returned, or about 45 minutes in all, before we were asked to come to the counter to register. Our reservation was for a double room with a Queen bed, but our very small room had two twin beds. I promptly went back to reception to request a room with a double bed, but was told that there were none available. We had arrived at the hotel just after the check-in time of 2:00 pm, so I was very surprised at this, but we were stuck with the room we had. The room was clean and comfortable, as other reviewers have noted, but here are several significant items - listed in the description of rooms on the hotel website - that are NOT in the room: daily complimentary water, bathroom phone, sofa, trouser press, complimentary newspaper. In addition, the website says the hotel has a "lounge" on site. We took this to mean a place serving alcohol - what else does a "lounge" mean? But the hotel lost their liquor license several years ago and there is NO alcohol in the hotel at all. The "lounge" is several black faux leather sofas on the mezzanine floor where you can sit and chat. Other grossly misleading informatgion on the website says that the hotel is 1.2 km from the gold souq. The gold souq is on the other side of the creek in Deira and is a good 10 to 15 minute cab ride! Not even 1.2 km "as the crow flies". Also, the hotel apparently realizes that their airport shuttle service has had problems (e.g., noted by travelers in other reviews) and a notice in the rooms now says that the service must be ordered 7 hours in advance and the time to the airport cannot be predicted. But the very worst part about this hotel is the attitude of the staff on the reception desk. We returned from walking the creek area and surrounding souqs all day long, at the end of our first full day in Dubai, and found no replacement bottles of "compliementary" water. in our room We called the front desk and were told that water is provided only at check-in. I disagreed and read from our hotel voucher that we would receive daily complimentary water and newspaper (the newspaper never showed up either). The woman argued with me and said that no, they don't provide complimentary water, just what is in the room when you arrive. She said we would have to order more water from room service and pay for it. My partner took the hotel voucher and went down to have a "full and frank" discussion with her. Unbelievably - she still argued with him that we could have no more free water. So he asked for the manager. The manager was very helpful and acknowledged that we should have had free water (2 small bottles) every day and also a newspaper. He sent a plate of fruit to the room as an apology, along with 2 large bottles of water. As outrageous as it was to pay more for this three-star hotel than we have usually paid for high-end accommodations in Dubai and elsewhere, I didn't mind because it was a last-minute reservation during a holiday weekend. But the staff at the reception desk were just horrible - rude, brusque and completely unhelpful. We have stayed in Dubai hotels that are much more modest than this - the Ambassador, for example, which is ancient in Dubai terms - but never have we been treated this poorly. Please do not give this hotel your business.

Reviews.Title: “Location wise good but bad customer service !”
Reviews.Author: kumarikac
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week. This hotel is on an excellent location with proximity to the commercial areas. Rooms are small...good breakfast spread...but poor customer service. The front desk lady goofed up and never admitted her fault...she was rude and kept arguing. I called for the manager...though he waived off some charge because of the staff's fault, yet I had to pay some of it ! Poor Customer Service !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: aahammayo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the admiral plaza hotel on a two day stopover from delhi enroute lagos.nice small rooms with complementary breakfast ina nice location of the city.it had shuttle bus service which we tried and was good.food was average and managable though I mostly ate at the singh punjabi resturant.I may come back but its not as good as other hotels I've tried on my visits to the city.

Reviews.Title: “not so recommendable”
Reviews.Author: sag10
Reviews.Content: the hotel is jst fine...the rooms are small...the prices are cheap..bt the hotel rooms are nt tht good..its not so cleaned...because its a affordable stay over...overall its jst moderate hotel..nthing lesiure...

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Saabi13
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Dubai for 2 days on a layover to another country. I booked the Admiral to spend my night while I tour the city during the day. The hotel was small but staff was friendly and helpful. The room was quite small, seemed congested with my suitcase in the room but the bed was comfortable and offered me a well-needed sleep. I would stay here again if I travel alone, however, if you are traveling with another person then you might want to stay at another hotel which offers larger rooms. It was in a prime location with shops all around and they offer free shuttle service to and from the hotel which was very convenient. I was able to book my city tour through the concierge service so it saved me a lot of trouble as well. Overall, nice place to stay, would recommend more to a solo travel rather than an entire family.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate Hotel in Dubai..”
Reviews.Author: dnp10
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in Shopping area. Just across the Electronic shopping market. Airport Pickup- We have opted for hotel pickup service which was delayed for 30 mins. Rooms- rooms are small for a family of four. after putting extra bed their is hardly any space for roam around. Breakfast- adequate and enough to start a day with hot and cold. over all ok stay in reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever stay I had in my leisure life.”
Reviews.Author: SrinuIPS
Reviews.Content: This is the worst ever hotel I have ever stayed in my life. Emirates airliens had booked this 3 star hotel for me as part of Dubai Stopover on my to India trip. Our struggle started right from entering into the hotel lobby. Reception staff did not acknowledged and we did wait for 10 minutes to find an assistance boy to help with our luggage. After 20 minute wait at the reception (staff were busy in attending guests & calls) we finally been provided with room keys. No water inside the fridge. Most funniest and annoying thing is, the TV is located left to your bed. You have to lay down on the bed and at your left to watch it which is horrible and you could not even watch it for 5 mins due to the pain. On the good side, well, the holiday/leisure booking team is good and helpful. If you prefer hospitality and pleasent stay, better to avoid it. The itenary says, there is a free Wi-Fi, but you don't get it in your room. You need to go to the business launge to access the WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend staying in this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: milen13
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was having heart attack trying to get confirmation of reservation from the hotel and to arrange airport pickup. Secondly, nobody met us at the airport (despite the arrangement) and we had to take a taxi. The taxi driver was having hard times trying to find the hotel (as a result, we paid bigger amount). The room was very small (they claimed to have reserved a studio), obscure and stinky. We saw a cockroach in the room and there was a hair in the french fries at breakfast. The breakfast was ok, though very Indian oriented (as the vast majority of the guests were Indians). The hotel was terribly noisy, one could hear anything going on in the rooms around incl the water flow in the bathroom. We were able to quietly sleep only 1 night out of 5. And the room had a common door with the neighbouring room and once an Indian young guy broke into our room in the middle of the night! The cleanliness of the hotel leaves much to be desired. The staff was ok, the only plus of the hotel was the business center with free access to internet.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at any cost, Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: tjsshh
Reviews.Content: • Airport Pick up:- I landed in Dubai on 26th January early morning, 12.30 AM. On meeting airport pick up person from Hotel Admiral Plaza, they are informing me that bus/car to take me to hotel is not available and will take atleast 30-45 minutes to arrange for the same. Actually they were waiting for few more customers who were expected to land after me in some time so that they don’t have to make more trips between airport and hotel. Now in middle of night without my fault why one should wait. • Availability of rooms: - On reaching hotel by myself by hiring taxi, I came to know from hotel reception that they don’t have room for me!!!! Either I should wait till morning 4 AM when they are expecting some check out OR they will place me in another hotel. When I paid for my room for whole day, when I am receiving confirmation from hotel about booking, on what ground they can allocate rooms to anyone else??? As I didn’t had any option, I had accepted their offer to go to another hotel thinking it will be nearby. To my shock it was very far and middle of nowhere. • Poor facility : - Next day my luggage was shifted from new hotel to Admiral Plaza by hotel staff so it was good but when I check internet in room, it was not working at all. On inquiring to reception, I came to know that internet is working only in mezzanine floor. The hotel keep on misguiding customer through their website about wifi availability in room but it didnt work in room and if I would have known about this fact, I would have never accepted this hotel. • Airport drop :- On 27th January, I booked airport drop for 7 PM. Till 7.45 PM there was no sign of car/bus for airport. On inquiring with reception about the status of car/bus, to my shock she said: “ I don’t know status and it is not my problem if car/bus doesn’t come in time”. Looking at this kind attitude, without taking any chance, I had gone to airport by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel location”
Reviews.Author: Taj28
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights with my family, hotel was clean, however I did find one cockroach on the desk in the hotel room. We did not find the room very clean found some take away items ontop of the table. The hotel was OK for a cheap nights stay, however it has to be in one of the worst locations of Dubai. From my experience you are better off staying at a better hotel which is further away from the airport, as taxi is cheap in Dubai. We also arranged a city tour with the hotel, it was absolutely a waste of time, we were charged too much to see about 5 sites where we only had 5 mins to spend to take pictures, later on found out taking a taxi would have cost has less than 50% of what we were charged by the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Can do better”
Reviews.Author: BriNairobi
Reviews.Content: Hotel doesn't quite look like the picture in the internet.its a lot more squeezed and on a side street in Bur dubai next to shopping area.pool area poorly lit and creepy.Breakfast offered mainly suits the Indian clientele and not friendly to other visitors.Rooms not cleaned well and are rather dirty

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and location, but middling to terrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: PreacherKane
Reviews.Content: The hotel had arranged to do an airport pick-up but was late (or our flight came in early) so we were wandering around for a bit until the driver made himself known. However, we got to the hotel in good time without any fuss. Upon arrival, the hotel lobby looked clean and professional, gold trim setting off polished marble, seasoned with Christmas tree and fake presents (wrapped in "happy birthday" paper), behind which was a lounging area in front of the restaurant area. Seating regions were cooled and comfortable with complimentary drinks (urns of hot water and other drinks left over from breakfast), making it a relaxing and pleasant environment to wait in. The mezzanine floor above contained the business centre and access to the gym, swimming pool and sauna, as well as a railway-themed Indian restaurant to the side. Prices for eating there - and room service in general - were markedly higher than you'd find on the street, so we elected to eat out instead of trying hotel food (apart from breakfast). The breakfast service was variable; although it was self-service, waitresses would occasionally rush up to offer tea/coffee for us, neglecting to spot that the table hadn't been relaid following previous diners - on a few occasions I had to prompt waiting staff (standing around, staring vacantly) for bread refills or more/clean cutlery. Nevertheless, there was plenty of food to suit a wide range of palates as well as fresh fruit and hot/cold drinks, and complimentary papers, meaning a fairly good start to the day. My only advice is to get there earlier before the hot food has had a chance to dry out, so you're not kept waiting for diner-initiated replenishments. Service offered by the Business Centre up on the Mezzanine floor was quite poor. I tried to book a safari tour through the desk attendant; he rang it through and - finding no answer - told us to try back later. He showed no sign of taking our details and trying on our behalf, so we ended up walking into town and booking it ourselves through another travel agency, who demonstrated much greater efficiency. In the business centre I had difficulties printing from any of the three public machines (they had several unidentifiable printers listed, but only two visible in the room - and one of those wasn't actually network-enabled) - I had to cut n' paste an image into a word document on the attendant's work machine to print out a map. Occasionally the machines would flick over to another wireless network, necessitating the attendant to correct the network connections, but from the third day onwards internet speeds were very slow - whether this was a problem with the hotel or their ISP (or routing in general) I couldn't tell, but the staff didn't seem that interested, merely shrugging it off with "the site is being slow". It seemed apparent to me - from the mouse actions of the different attendants - that they'd not been trained (or were too experienced) in many of the systems they were expected to support. The overall tone was that it wasn't suitable for business needs; there was too much maintenance and manual intervention required that suggested thoughtlessness and inefficient set-up. The bedroom itself was large and clean, with TV, safe, fridge, drinks-making facilities and on-suite bathroom. The overall décor looked as though someone had raided a retirement home for furniture and fittings; two lights had been wired into one plug and the thermostat on the wall was an ageing circular design, lacking a cover, but soon figured out what combination of switches and dials worked the lights, air-con and bathroom fan. The adjoining bathroom was somewhat shabby with broken tiles, badly-repaired grout and splatter mould in shelf corners plus a very stiff tap to get shower to work - however it wasn't grotty enough to prevent use. Nonetheless, clean towels were always provided, and it served its purpose. We couldn't use the safe - it was already locked and we'd been given no combination. The fridge didn't chill properly (a large ice block at the back showed that it hadn't been maintained recently) but contained complimentary bottles of water, which only appeared on the first day - I wasn't sure if these were intended to be replenished daily, like the tea/coffee provided (although these stocks were permitted to run low and we had to keep requesting more supplies). The TV was hooked up to satellite but had no operating instructions; I flicked it over to AV to see the satellite programmes but since they were all tuned to Arabic channels we stuck to terrestrial TV which showed BBC. Despite all this - and some construction work taking place out the back of the hotel near our room - I slept quite soundly in beds with sheets and blankets, oddly. The swimming pool was open - small and somewhat dimly-lit, but suitable for a family to take a paddle and swim a few 10m lengths. The sauna looked like a cleaner's cupboard in the pool's changing rooms - just a wooden walled-off corner. However, this was out of operation, as was the gym (since sept, according to previous reports mentioned here) and nobody in the hotel seemed to know when they would be available. The lack of attention to detail extended to the front desk where I received terrible customer service; the travel agency had rang and left a message for us concerning another trip but this message was never communicated along (we checked daily, fearing that the desk wouldn't be proactive in volunteering this information, but they weren't even particularly good at recording information). We wanted to book an airport taxi for the morning flight and was told it was free, but only discovered much later (when enquiring about pick-up times) that the hotel's complimentary taxi runs every hour - which meant a long wait at the airport, so instead had the front desk organise a paid taxi booked for the correct time. When returning to the hotel that evening we checked the taxi booking but the woman on duty could find no record of it, although she still confirmed it was booked okay (not sure how she arrived at that conclusion). The next morning no taxi arrived, the front desk denied any knowledge that one was ever booked nor requested (because no record existed) and in desperation the bellhop nipped out down the street and flagged one down for us. Out of all the staff there, the bellhops seemed the most customer-focussed and efficient; it is a pity they are required to perform above and beyond their normal call of duty due to incompetent reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ArynAjalaTravel
Reviews.Content: My stay at Admiral Plaza was extremely pleasant. The only hitch i had was that they didnt pick me up from the airport as promised, simply becase some1 typed in the wrong details for my flight. I got into the hotel at 4:30am. I asked for an early checkin which was meant tobe 9am, they checked me in at 7:30am. That was a wow! Then they took me up to a quiet lounge to rest and i did rest. Also the kitchen staff were laying out the breakfast at about 5am and i was starving. I had breakfast and it was sumptous. I had a clean room, the bed was mazzive. the bathroom had several towels, including toilteries! The ambience was more than i expected since a lot of reveiws i read had been negative. I was so pleantly surpirsed. It was truly a 3 star hotel . The staff were nice, they worked shifts and spoke several languages and were rather helpful about pointing out locations and nearby attractions. The hotel is well located. Close enough to attractons and close to the Meena Bazaar where i got a lot of deals. I went to dubai witha a bias about the hotel, but it was turned around. I will definetly stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: madhuvan
Reviews.Content: Excellent place located in the centre of the city. Shopping mall at walkable distance. Good Indian restaurants nearby. Easy to transit. Will have a feeling of old Dubai.Will definitely recomment to my friends. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “in old section of Dubai, good for shopping”
Reviews.Author: pumpa11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ok, but in the old section of Dubai so if you want to go see all the atractions you will have to go by taxi, which is relatively cheap. Nearby there is good shopping and lots of bargains to be had. Unfortunately there is a building being constructed at the rear of the Hotel, so would give this one a miss till that is finished, can effect your sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevinwatson
Reviews.Content: Cheap hotel for Dubai in the electronics/bazaar district. This was obviously a very nice hotel 15 years ago but is now just an adequate hotel as its standards are of a lower level than the quality of the building dictates. Small clean room, lift, low room rates. Enough said. Does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location.”
Reviews.Author: nareneye
Reviews.Content: Last year We had stayed at the Hilton Creek-very dissapointing! Our stay for 4 nights was great.Airport transfer was great.We were delayed yet he waited patiently.Rooms were fine as well as the breakfast.Food was pricey for room service, but there are pleanty of eating places and juice bars within seconds away! Staff were very helpful and I think you have to judge a place by value in what you are paying.Don't compare to 5 star! The hotel has though not linked to them a very impressive Train Themed restaurant and food and ambience was great. Next time I stay in Dubai,I will certainly use Admiral Plaza. Be polite and patient with staff and you will get the best from them. 14/07/2010--17/07/2010 pankhania

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: KarimiMantri
Reviews.Content: The rooms are compact but have all amenities. Service is poor but we had taken a package and hence, service may be affected. Breakfast spread was satisfactory. Hotel location is excellent but need to take a taxi to Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great rates”
Reviews.Author: Zar_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stated in the hotel for 2 nights and the room was very clean, good size and excellent service. The breakfast buffet was great as well. I will highly recommand this hotel for anyone espl for families with young children. The location was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Hotel pick up service and attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: ozzietripper
Reviews.Content: We were told that the hotel person would pick us from the airport. He eventually found us after 30 minutes hanging around the airport. He then told us we had to wait another 30 minutes for the hotel bus. After arriving at 1am in the morning we were frustrated and very tired at the lack of SERVICE. Do Dubai hotel people know anything about service? When we arrive at the hotel we told the management we wanted a 7am wake up call which didn't happen. The only highlight was the breakfast which was very nice and the free wifi on the mezzaine floor. We plan to stay elsewhere next time

Reviews.Title: “full value for money”
Reviews.Author: googledoodle
Reviews.Content: a hotel with best facilities in best rates and in best location. located in heart of the shopping place of bur dubai , the hotel indeed adds to the sweet memories of ones visit . this hotel is perfect for a family of two adults and two kids or even 4 adults as they have thoughtfully put two full king sizes double beds in the double room this added to our fun in dubai .

Reviews.Title: “Nothing good about it”
Reviews.Author: Uday27
Reviews.Content: Horrible service , very bad attitude of staff , rooms smell of cigarrates , just about average food quality , very small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “avoidable, unless on a budget”
Reviews.Author: PremiereTraveller
Reviews.Content: avg. rooms, only to come back and sleep..if you are on a tight budget and out for shopping and sightseeing all day only to come back and sleep/ shower in the room.. then it might be ok.. rooms are very very avg., location is OK.

Reviews.Title: “UAE”
Reviews.Author: rohitd29
Reviews.Content: Hotel Admiral Plaza is around 45 minutes drive from the airport of Dubai. This hotel is located in busiest area of Bur Dubai and is near to the sea. The hotel has well equipped rooms, a gym, an indoor swimming pool , a 24 hour coffee shop, restaurants and all other basic amenities required for a comfortable stay. The hotel serves continental buffet to all its guests which is outstanding. My stay in this hotel was a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, terrible managemnet and staff”
Reviews.Author: sgrewal
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay in this hotel. The management and stay are downright rude and unhelpful. They do not tell you this in advance but require you to deposit you passport with them on checking in. They a;so asked us to make full payment for our stay at the time of our check The staff are rude and refused to allow us to use their phone to make an emergency call. Rooms are small and old. Very poor maintenance. Fitness machines don not work. The management is totally uncaring and unresponsive to guests needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good potential-Terrible Management”
Reviews.Author: MarytravellerCanada
Reviews.Content: Pool out of service for "urgent" repairs---always said open tomorrow but never open in 3 days. Half of the exercise equipment was broken and unusuable 10 guests asleep in all the Lobby chairs----couldn't sit down Good breakfast--good location TV in room had to be physically replaced---broken. They wanted to stick 3 bare wires into the outlet, I said no it was a fire hazard so I had to wait while somebody put a proper plug on the wires. My view was the neighbours apt. 5 feet away and the constant pigeons on the ledge on my window-----and on and on. Don't believe the pictures!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Central Location”
Reviews.Author: parag385
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Bur Dubai Area thereby providing easy access to popular spots in the city. Popular mode of transport like Taxi, Bus Station & Water Taxi are easily available. The hotel is located in the market area and everythng is easily available. Also Carrefour is located nearby. The price of room is high compared to the the quality and service provided, but the main benefit of paying high room rate is that, it doesn't have any nightclub so there is no noise and you can have a sound sleep. I recommend this hotel for famlies and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Central but basic”
Reviews.Author: CandiedRosePetals
Reviews.Content: Value for money: For a 3 star hotel, I expected more from my money. The rooms are quite small, and yes, as the previous reviewer mentioned, you can get a hotel apartment much bigger, but it is further away and with not many shops around. I suppose it depends on whether you want to walk to attractions or if you will be catching taxis mostly. Travelling alone is expensive here, as I met another group of women who shared rooms and cut costs significantly. For an extra AUD40 a night I could have stayed in a pleasant 4 star hotel, and will do this on the next stopover. Location: The hotel is about 10-15 minutes walk to the creek, where the Dubai Souk and Abra stations are. These small boats cost AED1 to cross the creek to Deira (gold and spice souks). Little electronic stores and several food shops surround the alleyways and street of the hotel. There are always people walking around and it is quite busy. Catching a taxi is easy from the main st, 5 mins walk in either direction (Al Fahidi St, or Kalid Bin Al Waleed Rd. The Computer Plaza (Al Ain Plaza), Spinneys supermarket, and Jumbo Electronics are on Mankhool Rd close to the Metro. This is also convenient. Beware, the streets can be disorientating, and I recommend printing out google maps of the area. This area can be rather intimidating for women travelling alone, as men have no shame and will hit on you (married or not) in taxis, when asking for directions, in shops, and you get stares when walking down the street. It is best to wear your poker face and do not act friendly to anyone (if you are a female independent traveller). I caught a taxi from the MOE to hotel, and the driver was trying to chat me up. Disgusting. Service: I stayed 3 nights in total, and the service was not consistent. Staff at front desk varied, and I had a bad experience trying to book a City walking tour, as they didn't understand what I was saying. Another time, the lady was very helpful and informed me of the free wifi on M level. And also beware of directions given, when they say it is close, it's best to check the map first! The bed was firm, and there were no loud parties going on at night, so sleep was good. You can, however, hear when people nearby are going in/out of their rooms, as the doors slam shut. The bathroom is small and average, but my shower curtain had an awful damp smell and the tile grouting needed a good mould clean in some areas. For a short stay, I let this slide. But I will not be booking my stopover through Emirates again, I am very disappointed they recommended I stay here as a solo female traveller. Food: I didn't eat here, so cannot comment. I bought fruit and snacks from Spinneys and ate that for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service by Naseem”
Reviews.Author: ARFINASH
Reviews.Content: My family had a wonderful stay at this hotel. the shops i like were nearby and mainly the hotel is located near meena bazaar. The staff including the manager was kind and generous. Thanks to the manager he upgraded our room to a suite and we loved it !!!!!! It is a good and quiet hotel compared to Alkhaleej, Rush inn where they have loud disco music.Once again a wonderful stay.Thumps up!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best 3 Stars in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Sumeet18
Reviews.Content: Most people I encounter while traveling, wish for 5 Star facilities in 2/3 Star prices. Now we need to change that psyche. We should rate a Hotel according to it's Property rating without comparing the facilities with a higher rated Hotel. If for e.g. I need to judge a 3 Star Hotel for Rooms, I should not compare the Room size, facilities, comfort etc. keeping in mind what I had experienced in a 5 Star Hotel, that would be incorrect & unjustified. I would rate it 5 points even if the Room is small but clean & cozy, because that's what I have paid for. The reason I am saying all the above is to justify that this Hotel is a "5 Star" amongst 3 Stars !! Neat & clean Room & Toilet, decent breakfast & great location. Offers Airport pick & drop, which is good a bonus that would otherwise set you back by an additional 100-120 Dirhams. The Hotel has an excellent location in Bur Dubai area with plenty of shops & restaurants around including Internet Cafes. The Indian Restaurant inside the Hotel themed on a Railway Coach offers good Indian Food & seemed quite popular, for even outside Guests were patronizing it. The Room was small but quite comfortable & never felt inadequate. With the Tea/Coffee maker, Refrigerator & Safety Locker inside the Room it never felt wanting anything more. Don't expect too much from the Pool, Business Centre etc. Ideally this Hotel is for Tourists only, with it's location & facilities that suit a particular type of Traveler only. Avoid this Hotel if going for Business or Recreation. The Front Desk Staff were the only people I mostly interacted with & they were quite pleasant & helpful. Burjuman Plaza is around a Km. away & has the Metro Station which takes you to most of the Malls & Offices that are popular, otherwise Taxis are reasonable enough, without making a hole in your pocket. On the whole it was a good experience traveling to Dubai & staying at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: DRANKA
Reviews.Content: Value for money hotel, nice location, good food, average room decor.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: sweety_g_bg
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very good location – 10 minutes walking distance to Dubai Museum and the creek, easy to find taxi. The rooms are clean, the bathroom is almost clean. The hotel is now a new built but the staff takes care to keep it up. The breakfast is OK if you do not expect too much. The restaurant for lunch is not recommended. They keep your passports till your check out. Coffee and tea can be made in the rooms. Welcome bottle of water. The free internet cost 1 dirham per 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kukrejamahesh
Reviews.Content: It was a good experience as the Hotel was situated at the heart of Dubai and from there everything was near the market and the malls and the Breakfast of the Hotel was the USP it was lavish and multi-cuisine type will definitely go there again and stay if get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sat_1412
Reviews.Content: Good hotel offering value for money. Breakfast was simple but sufficient. Hotel is in a good location. Al Ghubaiba bus station, Carrefour supermarket & Dubai creek are at walkable distances. The neighbourhood has some good Indian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Burj Al Arab, but a safe centrally located hotel suitable for budget minded travellers”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravellingGal
Reviews.Content: I am a single female traveler who stopped over in Dubai for three nights on my way to Rwanda. Being alone my first trip to Dubai, I required an economical hotel in a secure area with easy access to historical sights. I researched several hotels on Trip Advisor and settled on the Admiral Plaza. I had read a few reviews complaining about the establishment but there are always people who are hard to please. I have nothing but compliments for the staff and service. The front desk staff went out of their way to help me. The complimentary shuttle which I ordered for 7:00 a.m. was right on time to take me to the airport. The price, including a breakfast buffet, was very reasonable, around $270 Cad. total for my stay. The breakfast wasn't fancy but there was certainly a lot of variety in the hot and cold food available. The waiters continually cleared tables and replenished dishes. My room was clean and quiet. I enjoy exploring new areas on foot and found the Admiral Plaza a great location. The abras are nearby for those wishing to cross the creek and visit the Gold and Spice Souks. I would highly recommend the nearby Heritage House and adjacent school. On the Burj side itself, the Museum provides an interesting cool respite from the heat - 40 degrees in June.The bus terminal is nearby for those who want to visit Burj Al Arab or the Mall of the Emirates. I also took a Taxi from Burj Al Arab to the Palm and Atlantis. In brief I had a very enjoyable stopover in Dubai. I would certainly stay at The Admiral Plaza on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Alan17
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 adults and 2 kids. The hotel is very affordable and it is value for money. The restaurant food is quite good. The triple bed room was very spacious. Lots of shops are nearby and the taxis are also easily available from the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “efficient service”
Reviews.Author: octaveind
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in may/ june/2008 & found the property conveniently located in Bur Dubai. Found the service crisp & efficient. A very basic property without any frills. Food quality was OK , nothing to write home about. Good value for money if you are on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Real32
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in Admiral Plaza Hotel for business purpose. As my area of interest is Bur Dubai and Deira, the hotel is most conveinently placed.

Reviews.Title: “The facilities advertised dont work”
Reviews.Author: Dudholaboss
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are clean, some of the services provided and advertised are not up to the mark. The Wi Fi refused to work as the signal was too weak and the money paid was wasted. Booking done thru the hotel for a cruise in the creek was a total distaster. Better be careful and check, recheck in detail and confirm that all you pay for works.

Reviews.Title: “great position and staff”
Reviews.Author: LEW1955
Reviews.Content: Admiral Plaza is 3 star and as such I did not have great expectations, so was happy that it more than met our requirements. The rooms were clean and a reasonable size. The position was excellent - near a main road so could always get a taxi readily. The staff, mainly Indian in background and particularly the female receptionist, went out of their way to assist and to communicate in English. It was Ramadan so this was restrictive, however, this hotel was happy to curtain off the restaurant and serve food. The breakfast buffet offered a reasonable selection. A great place to stay for the middle-aged budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay away!! Terrible staff, terrible breakfast and the water was Brown!”
Reviews.Author: traveller8888London
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here at any cost. Having been to dubai a number of times before I wanted a hotel near the meena bazar area... Whilst the area is great for indian shoppings stay away from the hotel... on the first night we got there everything seemed to be fine, we were picked from the hotel and the room was basic but clean. The bathroom wasnt great but was not too bad to use. the following morning the breakfast was terrible, fruit out of a tin, toast made hours before left out to get rock hard and a few other dishes all of which were cold.... after a day of sight seeing we got back to the hotel and to our horror on putting the bathroom tap on the water was brown!! on reporting the problem no one came to help so we decided to go back out on our return the problem remained so we asked to see the manager who was a terrible person to talk to.. they moved us into another room after assuring us the other room was fine but it wasnt!! I spent the next 5 hours going from room to room checking the water.. the problem persisted and we left the following morning! Go and stay at the Arabian courtyard its in the same area not too expensive but a much better hotel! Stay away from the admiral plaza if you want to enjoy your time in dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Deanus14916
Reviews.Content: I intentionally booked a 3 star, expecting an average room and service standard. After reading the reviews here I was unsure as to my choice. As it turned out it was fine. The room was more than spacey, a littel outdated perhaps but I wasn't expecting a lavish stay. All that comes with a standard 3 star was offered and presented. A little difficulty in communicating with desk staff, mostly Indian(which for me have always been rude and arrogant). Overall I eventually got through and made a point of them returning my passpaort after a scan. For what I wanted to do it was in a good location, the desert tour I booked was on time, and I was advised by hotel staff that it had arrived. The hotel is fine for a budget traveller and nothing else. No problems with ther guests or noise, in fact I didn't see anyone or didn't see any other guests during their stay. Until it changes since my stay, I would recommend this hotel for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fine, really”
Reviews.Author: shaun1967
Reviews.Content: I am finding it hard to reconcile some of the comments offered by others with my direct experience. OK, so there may be bigger rooms, but I have also had smaller. The room was clean, the bed was big and comfy and all the electrical items, hot water, AC etc worked Staff were friendly, responsive but not intrusive, and breakfast gave a good range of options for various nationals. Location is good for the Burjuman shopping centre (15 minute walk or a cheap taxi) and the creek (10 minute walk) I saw a comment suggesting that the place was somehow crawling with pushy prostitutes. This is the comment I find hardest of all to reconcile. The hotel is in a good area (not that there are any seedy areas in Dubai, anyway) and I can honestly say I only saw one lady who MAY have been a prostitute on my entire visit to Dubai - and she was sauntering alongside the creek - there was nothing at all like this in the hotel, the lobby was always clean, friendly and relaxed Now my stay was sponsored by my employers, so I don't know what people have paid to stay here, so it may be possible that a better room may be had for the rate. Maybe people do think better deals are to be had, I don't know, but this hotel is certainly no hell hole as has been suggested. Its not a 7 star hotel, or even a 5 star hotel, but by US standards (not developing world standards) it is certainly at least a 3 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “better than an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: amrinder1m
Reviews.Content: this hotel is smaller than the other hotels i have stayed in but it was clean and the staff was accomodating.breakfast was real good having variety. we were 3 doctors and stayed there for 4 days for a conference in dubai.we were given a triplet room. it was spacious .bathroom was with bathtub.clean environment. overall good stay and it was cheap too.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sarah272
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were told we're lucky to have such a nice room and all...what they described to be ''nice'' turned out to be VERY small for 2 people, but that's not the worst - the bathroom is small, smelly and has green and blue stains on it's walls which makes it a real pleasure to take showers. *yuck* And then there is the bed... the sheets were not changed for 3 days and the blankets were itchy and too thin for the air condition, speaking of which: the air condition is damn noisy, goes on and off all night, the cold air hits your face directly. So we woke up with a blocked nose. Don't get me started on the pool - we didn't even bother swimming in it. So you're sitting in this hotel - spending your time outside or watching movies on a miniature TV and ordering from their restaurant which I don't recommend. Overall the hotel is badly organized, not worth the money and the atmosphere is suffocating - definitely killed our holiday. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not as described”
Reviews.Author: diva3UK
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL unless you are happy to do nothing but watch TV!. Staying at this hotel ruined our holiday to Dubai. We booked to stay for a week having been tempted by the hotel website showing pool facilities, jacuzzi and a bar. Upon arrival we were shown to our room which for two people was VERY small. There was no room to relax apart from one small chair. The fridge did not work and the view out over the back of flats was grotty. After two requests someone did come and change the fuse and the fridge did eventaully work. However, the hotel described 'mini bar facilities' (there were none). When we enquired about the pool we were shown down a dark corridor to a locked door. The pool looked about half full and we were told someone would have to come and unlock the door if we wanted to use it. The final straw was that when we asked where the bar was so we could chill out over a glass of wine, we were told it had shut down (it's still advertised within the hotel). Remember the only place you can buy alcolhol in Dubai is in hotels! The only good thing we can say is that the hotel was clean and our rooms were tidied daily. Over all it is cheap in comparison with other Dubai hotels but spend a bit more and check out this website in more detail than we did - it will be well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “No atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: WestburyWiltshire
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at the Admiral plaza in Dubai, the hotel is ok for a 3*, however I did encounter problems with the water, I arrived & wanted to shower the water was brown, after 3 days of them trying to get the problem rectified I was moved to another room, yipee a bath that although was very tired I actualy felt clean!! The hotel bathrooms do leave alot to be desired. Some of the hotel staff were very nice, some I felt looked down a little on me travelling without a male I feel. The hotel website is also misleading it states that their is a bar, they do not sell and alcholic beverages at all, the hotel was empty every evening, for me personally I do not feel the need to go out every evening, it would have been nice after a busy day just to chill in the hotel with a glass of wine. The hotel also states that there are free beach transfers, this also was not provided. Be warned the noise from the traffic is quite bad. The upside of this hotel were the people I met there, being outgoing I will introduce myself. Things to do, the Dune safari was good fun (When they eventually picked us up, they are always late), the trip was around £30, for us this trip was great as I was met up with my sister, her husband, Ceilia & Mark from South Africa that we met in the hotel who were really lovely genuine peope. I also ate in several nice places, my favorite being Spice Island (renaisance hotel) in Deira, its a 5* hotel with food & drink to match, all you can eat & drink for around £27, food galore & excellent quality. We went on the dow cruise which was also very nice. We did several Malls, the biggest being the Emerites Mall, I personally didnt buy much as the prices were the same as in the UK, they have a ski centre there which my son loved. Be warned though do not leave at 5pm like I did as the traffic is terrible, try to avoid travelling between 5 and 8pm. Taxi's are cheap Well enjoy Dubai, feel free to e-mail me for any other questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: “xmas and new years”
Reviews.Author: Sheel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for xmas and new years, Airport pick up was not there , so paid for my own on complaining to reception one of the clerks said the driver is at the airport which was not true......, so let it be, initial room small b ut requested and got another one..., overrall if any problems and we called there was someone sent promptly to try and sort out the problems, clean rooms, no loud music and bars as they have been closed , but nearby astoria there if u want any of that... Great plus was the location.............. negative was the receptionist, who is stubborn and does not want to listen if you ask him to reimburse for things the hotel should have provided..........

Reviews.Title: “Admiral Plaza Hotel - OK for stopover”
Reviews.Author: Freolife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night stopover. Big bonus is their airport pickup and drop-off. We were late landing, and the queues at immigration were horrendous, but the man was still there waiting for us! He was also friendly and talkative, which is a bonus in Dubai! The hotel is just average - ok if you book when it is being offered as a last minute cheap deal. The room was nothing special, but not terrible. It was clean and the shower and toilet both worked and were reasonable. Hotel rooms don't come cheap in Dubai and we have experienced both better and worse hotels in Dubai for around the same price as this one. Didn't go anywhere and so am unsure how well it is positioned for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “cool”
Reviews.Author: ozzichick
Reviews.Content: spacious room, cool compared to the searing heat outside negatives- dodgy view of sigletted hairy men on their balconies, dodgy area, strange food for breakfast, no food available during the day anywhere

Reviews.Title: “I've been to worse”
Reviews.Author: AliceLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us by a family friend, we wanted a cheap hotel that could accommodate the four us, and this is what we got. Although I have previously stayed in amazing hotels, in my opinion, a hotel is just a hotel, it's a place to sleep, spending the whole day or night in the hotel is something that can be done in your country of residence at a cheaper cost. We were given the Quad, it was very grey and ugly looking, we were not impressed, but we put up with it. It all started when the music started, the bass was thumping that we couldnt sleep. When we complained, we were advised that this was the nightclub and it stops at around midnight. In fairness to the person we spoke to, it did stop around midnight. The next day however, we made a complaint and asked to change rooms. We were moved that day and this room was MUCH better. Not only was it not grey, it had space and looked cleaner. At night we could not hear the music, so we were fine. Like I said, I've been to worse, if you are planning on going out and around Dubai, like we did, it's fine as a place to sleep. We found the staff to be very friendly, the porter that moved our bags into the new room, was very helpful. The biggest letdown in this hotel, was the prostitutes. There are too many and they do not care if the mans wife is sat next to her, they will still try it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected, after reading previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: OzML
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days in early November. We booked through a travel agent, but selected the hotel for its location after looking on the internet, despite reading many negative reviews. We wanted to be close to the creek, bus station and souks, and this hotel was well positioned. While the staff were generally cold, we were happy with the room (very clean) and the stay was good. The Breakfast buffet had a mixture of western and both Indian and Middle Eastern items, which I felt were much better than the western items. There are a wide selection of local restaurants nearby, which we sampled and enjoyed, as these were dramatically cheaper than food available at th hotel. We didn't see any signs of sleaze around the place, and would probably stay here again, or certainly in this area (Bur Dubai).

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Admiral Plaza”
Reviews.Author: TheWallaby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights in this hotel, and changed rooms twice in that period (IE three different rooms). The first room we got was maybe 10' X 10' ... I've never seen such a small hotel room other than in the developing world. It was something that I'd expect in a sort of hostel! Upon seeing this, we asked the fellow who had helped with our bags if all the rooms were like this - he said yes. After that, I went to the front desk, and they moved us across the hall to a room that was, surprise, twice the size. Okay - so night came and we figured, lets go eat. There were three restaurants in the place, and we entered the first. Was a bunch of single guys sipping drinks around a raised stage with several girls dancing to overly loud music. No problem, two others to pick from, right? Well guess what, both of the other two were the same. This was prostitute central! Ended up walking to some corner stores and buying fruit and the like. So, the second night and there is major loud music vibrating the room. Turns out , in additon to the three 'restaurants' that were on the other side of the building (poors folks staying on top of them), there was another party room, that was under our room. There was no where to go but up, so we went to the front and they changed us right away (they were very slick about it - I wasn't the first to complain). Anyway, we were now on the top floor, but the vibrations just carried. Then, when nothing else could go wrong, the AC stopped working. Had to call the front at 2AM, and they sent someone to fix things. The boom-boom sound kept going till past 3AM.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: MilesDependent
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Admiral Plaza in April and was generally unimpressed. Room - The room is standard 3 star. It is a decent size (around 300 square feet or 29 square meters), but it is generally worn and showing signs of age. The bathroom is large with a bath and shower, but the water pressure was soooooo bad. I could not gen enough pressure to get the shampoo out of my hair. The bar in the lobby is FULL of prostitutes. It was very unpleasant. Also, our room was directly above the bar so all night we could here the "bang bang bang" of the music - it stopped around 4am. And then at 8am the construction would start above our room, so there was constant drilling. Not impressed. Service - The staff are not very friendy and nor do they need to be. This hotel is part of the Emirates stopover deal, and therefore they get guests regardless of how good/bad the hotel is. The staff just don't really care about the guests. They give you your room key and that's about it. Food - The buffet breakfast is very ordinary. I could cook a better breakfast myself and I am a bad cook. Lobby - The lobby area is small but well decorated. Location - The area around the hotel is full of character - very Arabic. There are plenty of small shops and restaurants. There seemed to be more computer shops than anything else. The great thing about the location is it is a 5 minute walk down to the creek, so you really are in the heart of the city.

HotelInfo.Name: Admiral Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Al Nahdha St , | PO Box 26888, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
